snippet: When the Miami Marlins suspended their manager, Ozzie Guillen, for expressing admiration for Fidel Castro, the team succumbed to the cries of locals for business reasons.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the Miami Marlins for suspending manager Ozzie Guillen for expressing his support for Fidel Castro; notes that Guillen expressed admiration for Castro's longevity, not for his oppressive reign over Cuba; holds that while the Marlins may be within their legal rights, they should have thought harder before succumbing to the cries of Miami's easily incited Cuban exile community and punishing a political statement for business reasons.
lead_paragraph: When the Miami Marlins suspended their manager, Ozzie Guillen, for expressing admiration for Fidel Castro, the team succumbed to the cries of locals for business reasons.
